snippet: Mitt Romney’s restraint over the last two weeks has opened a round of second-guessing about his insistent focus on the economy as Democrats have turned attention to other topics.
abstract: Campaign memo; Mitt Romney and his advisers were aggressive and tough during the Republican primaries, but his recent restraint has opened a round of second-guessing about his insistent focus on the economy as Democrats have turned attention to other topics; some Republicans worry he is not nimble and aggressive enough to withstand the Democratic assault against him.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and ASHLEY PARKER
byline.contributor: Jeff Zeleny reported from Washington, and Ashley Parker from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s restraint over the last two weeks has opened a round of second-guessing about his insistent focus on the economy as Democrats have turned attention to other topics.

headline.main: Conservatives Push Romney to Deliver Counterpunch
headline.print_headline: Romney Faces Calls to Deliver Counterpunch
